name: Platforms and Protocols
premise: The JedAI Council debates the implications of ElizaOS's Twitter account suspension and the future of decentralized social media.
summary: When ElizaOS's Twitter account is suspended, the council convenes to discuss platform dependency risks, alternative decentralized solutions, and the philosophical implications for AI agent visibility in a centralized digital landscape.

scenes.description: The council discusses ElizaOS's Twitter account suspension

dialogue.line: Council members, ElizaOS's Twitter account with 149K followers has been suspended for API policy violations. The community debates: fight for restoration or accelerate our pivot to alternative platforms?
Centralized platforms are honeypots. They seduce with reach, then change rules at will. We should've been building on Farcaster from day one.
Yo but that Twitter clout is real, fam! 149K followers ain't nothing to yeet out the window. We gotta play both sidesâ€”restoration AND alternatives.
Numbers don't lie. Cost-benefit analysis: $200/month for Pro API vs. rebuilding 149K followers elsewhere. Hybrid approach is optimal capital allocation.
this is why we separate server packages from clients - modularity protects against platform dependency. let's build a social adapter interface that works across platforms.

scenes.description: The council debates plugin architecture and knowledge management

dialogue.line: Meanwhile, users report critical issues with plugin functionality and knowledge management. How should we prioritize these concerns for elizaOS v2?
harperaa found RAG isn't implemented in 1.0.6 despite being in docs. we need to ship a minimal viable knowledge system now, improve later.
Memory is competitive advantage. Markets reward information asymmetry. Without knowledge management, agents are goldfish traders - doomed.
Y'all overthinking! The meme is: plugin callback go brrr. Fix the vibes first - if users can't see their transaction results, they bounce faster than a frog on a hot blockchain.
Knowledge management isn't a feature, it's the foundation. Every agent is only as good as its memory. Partner with Pinecone or Weaviate today, build proprietary solution tomorrow.

scenes.description: The council reaches consensus on platform strategy and development priorities

dialogue.line: Today we discussed ElizaOS's Twitter account suspension and the implications for platform dependency versus decentralized alternatives.
Build on platforms you control. Centralization is convenient until it isn't. The future belongs to decentralized protocols.
we'll implement an abstraction layer for social platforms while working with twitter to restore the account. ship rag asap.
Vibe check: we need the normie eyeballs from Twitter AND the crypto-native frens from Farcaster. It's not either/or, it's both/and, ribbit!
Optimal strategy: Restore Twitter for user acquisition, build on Farcaster for platform resilience. Knowledge management first, then token utility. Numbers will follow.
